attributes.action: Government to provide more guidance, support & protection for NHS Agency workers
attributes.additional_details:
If agency staff are continued to be used on wards without the proper guidance or support, we will continue to see an increase in agency workers needing to self-isolate in line with government instructions until testing becomes available and a decrease in agency staff available when needed most.

We call on the government to review these most basic requirements for key workers within the healthcare agency sector to ensure patient care is prioritised as we as a nation continue to fight this virus.

rejection.details:
A number of the requests you make are operational matters for individuals NHS trusts, and not matters for the Government or House of Commons.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Pay NHS Agency Nurses, Doctors and Healthcare staff a wage if they self isolate: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/309771

Make Covid-19 testing available for all healthcare professionals: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304005

Supply PPE to all Health and Social Care workers including community carers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/314229

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
